Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PSTO2 7K (Phylloseptin-TO2 analog, synthetic AMPs, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, amphibian peptide analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (94.74%) toPSTO2L=A: 21%, S: 16%; I=K: 11%.Activity: active against Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 6538 or MRSA NCTC 12493 (MIC 4 uM), Gram- E. coli ATCC 8739 (MIC 8 uM), A.baumannii BAA 747 (MIC > 128 uM),  K. pneumonia ATCC 43816 (MIC 8 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 9027 (MIC 32 uM), and fungi C. albicans (MIC 32 uM). Rapid killing at 2xMIC. It binds to LPS.  inhibit biofilms:bacteria (S. aureus and E. coli); eradicate preformed biofilms:S. aureus. eradicate preformed biofilms:E. coliStructure: random coils in 10 mM NH4Ac and helical in 50% TFE.In vitro toxicity: horse RBC: HC50 32-64 uM.
Literature Information.Author: Yin W, Yao J, Leng X, Ma C, Chen X, Jiang Y, Wang T, Chen T, Shaw C, Zhou M, et al. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Enhancement of Antimicrobial Function by L/D-Lysine Substitution on a Novel Broad-Spectrum Antimicrobial Peptide, Phylloseptin-TO2: A Structure-Related Activity Research Study
